headers.subject: [tosdr:2027] Bing.com [good] Provides ways to opt-out of targeted advertising

html:
Bing.com has it's own Privacy Policy, even though it uses the Microsoft Services Agreement for its ToS. These privacy points apply only to Bing.com.

  • Advertising Opt-Out Controls. Because cookies may be used for many purposes, users who object to behaviorally targeted advertising may choose to accept cookies but opt out from that particular use. Companies in the online advertising industry have developed guidelines and programs to help protect users’ privacy, and these industry programs include web pages you can visit to opt out from receiving behaviorally targeted advertisements from all participating companies (including Microsoft). These pages include:   
  • Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) Consumer Choice Page: http://www.aboutads.info/choices/
  • Network Advertising Initiative (NAI) Opt-Out Page: http://www.networkadvertising.org/managing/opt_out.asp
  • In Europe, you may also visit Your Online Choices: http://www.youronlinechoices.com/
Individual advertising companies may also offer their own opt-out capabilities plus more advanced advertising choices. For instance, Microsoft’s advertising preference and opt-out controls are available at http://choice.live.com/advertisementchoice/. Please note that opting out does not mean that you will stop getting ads or see fewer ads; however, if you do opt out, the ads that you receive will no longer be behaviorally targeted. In addition, opting out does not stop information from being collected.
 
From <http://www.microsoft.com/privacystatement/en-us/bing/default.aspx#> 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Bing.com [good] Provides ways to opt-out of targeted advertising
text:
Bing.com has it's own Privacy Policy, even though it uses the Microsoft 
Services Agreement for its ToS. These privacy points apply only to Bing.com.


>    - Advertising Opt-Out Controls. Because cookies may be used for many 
>    purposes, users who object to behaviorally targeted advertising may choose 
>    to accept cookies but opt out from that particular use. Companies in the 
>    online advertising industry have developed guidelines and programs to help 
>    protect users’ privacy, and these industry programs include web pages you 
>    can visit to opt out from receiving behaviorally targeted advertisements 
>    from all participating companies (including Microsoft). These pages 
>    include:   
>
>
>    - Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) Consumer Choice Page: 
>    http://www.aboutads.info/choices/
>
>
>    - Network Advertising Initiative (NAI) Opt-Out Page: 
>    http://www.networkadvertising.org/managing/opt_out.asp
>
>
>    - In Europe, you may also visit Your Online Choices:

>
> Individual advertising companies may also offer their own opt-out 
> capabilities plus more advanced advertising choices. For instance, 
> Microsoft’s advertising preference and opt-out controls are available at 
> http://choice.live.com/advertisementchoice/. Please note that opting out 
> does not mean that you will stop getting ads or see fewer ads; however, if 
> you do opt out, the ads that you receive will no longer be behaviorally 
> targeted. In addition, opting out does not stop information from being 
> collected.
>  
> From <http://www.microsoft.com/privacystatement/en-us/bing/default.aspx#>
